title:
Characterizing Optimal-speed unitary time evolution of pure and
  quasi-pure quantum states
authors:
John A. Mora Rodr\'iguez, Brian Grajales, Marcelo Terra Cunha, Lino
  Grama
abstract:
We present a characterization of the Hamiltonians that generate optimal-speed
unitary time evolution and the associated dynamical trajectory, where the
initial states are either pure states or quasi-pure quantum states. We
construct the manifold of pure states as an orbit under the conjugation action
of the Lie group $\SU(n)$ on the manifold of one-dimensional orthogonal
projectors, obtaining an isometry with the flag manifold
$\SU(n)/\textnormal{S}(\textnormal{U}(1)\times \textnormal{U}(n-1 ))$. From
this construction, we show that Hamiltonians generating optimal-speed time
evolution are fully characterized by equigeodesic vectors of
$\SU(n)/\textnormal{S}(\textnormal{U}(1)\times \textnormal{U}(n-1))$. We later
extend that result to quasi-pure quantum states.
